tool_description: HHmake converts a multiple sequence alignment (MSA) file, typically generated by HHblits, into a Hidden Markov Model (HMM) file for downstream HMM-HMM comparisons (Need to determine if you need to use it after hhblits based on user requirements).

required_parameters.name: msa_file
required_parameters.description: A multiple sequence alignment (MSA) file in A3M format, typically generated by HHblits, which will be used to build the HMM.

optional_parameters.name: id
optional_parameters.description: Maximum pairwise sequence identity (%) to filter the alignment. This reduces redundancy in the MSA.

optional_parameters.name: diff
optional_parameters.description: Filter the MSA by selecting the most diverse set of sequences, keeping at least this many sequences in each MSA block of length 50.

optional_parameters.name: cov
optional_parameters.description: Minimum coverage with query (%) to include sequences in the alignment.

optional_parameters.name: qid
optional_parameters.description: Minimum sequence identity with the query (%) to include sequences in the alignment.

optional_parameters.name: qsc
optional_parameters.description: Minimum score per column with the query to include sequences in the alignment.

optional_parameters.name: neff
optional_parameters.description: Target diversity of the alignment. If enabled, HHmake will aim for this diversity level by controlling redundancy.

return_values.name: hmm_file
return_values.description: A Hidden Markov Model (HMM) file generated from the input MSA, ready for use in HHsearch or other tools.
